title.narrative: Pilot Research Cooperation with RUPP, Cambodia

description.narrative:
Royal University of Phnom Penh (RUPP) i Kambodja har hos Sida ansökt om 78 miljoner SEK för att genomföra programmet Enhancement of Research Capacity at RUPP towards Poverty Reduction and Sustainable Development under perioden 2019-01-01 till 2022-12-31.
Målsättningen med detta bilaterala forskningssamarbete är att stärka forskningskapacitetet på RUPP inom naturvetenskap och bioteknik samt att stärka universitetetes infrastruktur för informations- and kommunikationsteknologi (ICT). Vidare förväntas insatsen stärka den administrativa kapaciteten på RUPP och kapaciteten för research management inklusive uppföljning av resultat och medel. Insatsen planeras som en fyrårig pilotfas och förväntas resultera i utbildning av mastersstudenter och doktorander, etablering av nya och utveckling av befintliga mastersutbildningar och utveckling av ett forskarutbildningsprogram samt utveckling av ICT infrastruktur för hela universitet. Programmet koordineras av International Science Programme vid Uppsala Universitet (ISP/UU) och Swedish Program for ICT in Developing Regions vid Stockholm Universitet (SPIDER/SU) och genomförs i samarbete med svenska parteruniversitet. Utbildning av doktorander sker enligt ”sandwichmodellen” där kambodjanska studenter är antagna vid svenska partneruniversitet och genomför en del av forskarutbildningen i Sverige. De svenska partneruniversiteten bidrar också till undervisning på RUPP, utveckling av läroplaner, utbildning av handledare och gemensamma forskningsprojekt.
Den planerade maximala budgeten för insatsen är 79 miljoner SEK varav ca. 46,8 miljoner SEK kommer att utbetalas till RUPP och ca. 21,2 miljoner SEK till svenska partneruniversitet. Kostnader för uppehälle för kambodjanska doktorander i Sverige kommer att uppgå till ca. 5,6 miljoner SEK. Ca. 5,2 miljoner SEK kommer att utbetalas till ISP/UU och SPIDER/SU för koordinering och implementering av programmet.
Avtalsstrukturen för ovan samarbete regleras av fyra avtal på följande nivåer:
1) Stat-till-stat/Specific Agreement mellan Sverige representerat av Sida och Kambodja representerat av RUPP. Avtalet reglerar programmets övergripande budget och medel som tilldelas RUPP, svenska partneruniversitet och de svenska programkoordinatorerna ISP/UU och SPIDER/SU. Avtalet inkluderar ett Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) dokument som definierar roller, ansvar och rutiner för programmet på RUPP. RUPP och de svenska partneruniversiteten och programkoordinatorerna (se nedan) rapporterar till Sida i enlighet med detta avtal.
2) Avtal mellan Sida och de svenska programkoordinatorerna. Avtalen styrs av avtalet mellan Sida och RUPP och reglerar programkoordinering och vidareförmedling av medel till svenska partneruniversitet. Enligt Specific Agreement koordineras ICT-delprogrammet av SPIDER/SU och delprogrammen naturvetenskap och bioteknik av ISP/UU. Medel är allokerade i Specific Agreement men utbetalas direkt av Sida till SPIDER/SU och ISP/UU. ISP/UU kommer i sin tur att vidareförmedla medel till svenska partneruniversitet baserat på Sida-godkända avtal mellan ISP/UU och partneruniversiteten (se avtalsnivå 4). Årlig verksamhetsrapportering av vidareförmedlade medel sker på avtalsnivå 1 (se ovan), svenska partneruniversitetens årliga finansiella rapportering samordnas av ISP/UU. De svenska programkoordinatorerna ISP/UU och SPIDER/SU rapporterar till Sida i enligt med detta avtal.
3) Avtal mellan Sida och ISP/UU om utbetalning av medel för de kambodjanska doktoranders uppehälle i Sverige. Medel är allokerade i Specific Agreement men utbetalas direkt av Sida till ISP/UU som i sin tur betalar ut medel till kambodjanska studenter vid ankomst till Sverige. ISP/UU rapporterar till Sida i enlighet med detta avtal.
4) Avtal mellan ISP/UU och svenska partneruniversitet inom delprogrammen för naturvetenskap och bioteknik (godkända av Sida inkl. uppdragsbeskrivning för revision). Avtalen reglerar vidareförmedling av medel till de svenska partneruniversiteten baserat på årliga arbetsplaner och budgetar godkända av Sida. Årlig finansiell rapportering och revision av svenska partneruniversitet och vidareförmedlade medel regleras av detta avtal och koordineras as ISP/UU.

The Royal University of Phnom Penh (RUPP) in Cambodia has applied to Sida for funding of 78 million SEK to contribute to the programme Enhancement of Research Capacity at RUPP towards Poverty Reduction and Sustainable Development during the period 2019-01-01 until 2022-12-31.This bilateral research cooperation programme aims at building research capacity at RUPP in the areas of natural sciences and bioengineering as well as strengthening the university´s information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure. Furthermore, the programme is expected to strengthen RUPP's administrative and research management capacity including results and financial follow-up. The research cooperation will be set up as a 4-year pilot phase and is expected to result in education of MSc and PhD students, establishment of new and development of existing MSc programmes and development of one PhD programme as well as development of ICT infrastructure for the whole university. The programme will be coordinated by the International Science Programme at Uppsala University (ISP/UU) and the Swedish Program for ICT in Developing Regions at Stockholm University (SPIDER/SU) and carried out in cooperation with Swedish university partners. PhD education will be provided according to the “sandwich model” where Cambodian students are registered at Swedish universities and carry out part of their doctoral training in Sweden. The Swedish university partners will also contribute to teaching at RUPP, development of curricula, education of supervisors and collaborative research projects.The planned maximum contribution for the programme is 79 million SEK out of which approximately 46,8 million SEK will be released to RUPP and approximately 21,2 million SEK to Swedish university partners. Costs for subsistence allowances for Cambodian sandwich PhD students in Sweden will amount to approximately 5,6 million SEK. Approximately 5,2 million SEK will be released to ISP/UU and SPIDER/SU for programme coordination and implementation.

The objective of the intervention is to enhance the Royal University of Phnom Penh (RUPP) to conduct the strategy to develop and sustain quality research and innovation that will contribute to the development needs of Cambodia and beyond.

participating-org.narrative: RUPP/Royal University of Phnom Penh, Cambodia

tag.narrative: 9.5 - Enhance scientific research, upgrade the technological capabilities of industrial sectors in all countries, in particular developing countries, including, by 2030, encouraging innovation and substantially increasing the number of research and development workers per 1 million people and public and private research and development spending.

9.5 - Förbättra forskningen och industrisektorernas tekniska kapacitet i alla länder, i synnerhet utvecklingsländerna, bland annat genom att till 2030 uppmuntra innovation och väsentligt öka det antal personer som arbetar med forskning och utveckling per 1 miljon människor liksom de offentliga och privata utgifterna för forskning och utveckling.

title.narrative: Avtal mellan Sverige och Royal University of Phnom Penh, Kambodja
Beslut om insats Pilot forskningssamarbete med RUPP, Kambodja

description.narrative: The pilot phase of bilateral research cooperation with RUPP was started 1 January 2019 and has had a somewhat slower start-up phase than anticipated, and hence, the number of results achieved so far is limited. However, 2,5 years into the programme implementation is progressing and progress has been made in several parts of the programme. Status of programme implementation - The first Annual Review Meeting was to be held at RUPP in Phnom Penh 21-24 April 2020 but due to the COVID-19 pandemic this was not possible. Instead a series of online meetings, via Zoom, was successfully held between 8-24 June 2020. The online format proved very fruitful as e.g. all Swedish partners/supervisors participated (to travel twice a year to Cambodia for these meetings are not doable for most). - The second Annual Planning Meeting was held online between 17-24 November 2020. All involved in the program at RUPP, as well as PhD and master students, several Swedish partners, the Swedish Embassy and Sida participated and discussed next year’s work plan and budget, routines and processes, and other issues regarding the implementation of the program. - Two online meetings, May and October 2020 was held with Swedish partners, facilitated by ISP. The meetings contributed to a shared understanding of the program and its challenges and possibilities and are regularly held twice a year in preparation to the annual planning and review meetings. These meetings will probably continue to be held online to have as many participators as possible. - The Sida Agreement Coordination Workgroup that includes all programme and subprogramme coordinators, members of the Programme Manaegment Unit (PMU) has monthly meetings to coordinate the program - Eleven sandwich PhD candidates have been admitted to doctoral studies at Swedish partner universities (see list below). One PhD candidadate, Ms Chansorphea Srey, successfully performed English language studies at Jönköpings University in preparation for admission at the Department of Medical Chemistry at Uppsala University and started her PhD studies at UU in May 2020. All PhD students have now made their first visits to Swedish Partner Universities and their studies are making progress. - MSc programmes: courses are running with Swedish teaching contributions in Physics, Chemistry and Biodiversity conservation; curriculum development has been accomplished in mathematics and chemistry and are ongoing in several other areas. - In the ICT programme, RUPP and SPIDER performed a technical audit to get a complete inventory of existing ICT infrastructure and provide recommendations for solutions and configurations. The technical audit report was approved in May 2020 and will serve as basis for a project implementation and project activity plans. Due to the covid pandemic several infrastructure activities were delayed but RUPP made great progress in digital competence for meetings, workshops and online learning. - The STEM building was renovated under the World Bank HEIP program and the Procurement Plans for upgrading equipment and renovating research labs has been performed in Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Environmental Science and Bio-Engineering Sub-Programs. All equipment are listed with specifications and a direct procurement of urgent equipment started in the end of the year. - RUPP and the Physics sub-program organized the International conference on nanomaterial and applications. They also held monthly seminars in both subject areas and research methodology. - The peer-review journal (Cambodian Journal of Natural History), thesis books, and peer-review articles are valuable sources for researchers, policy and decision makers in Cambodia. Two issues [2020(1) and 2020(2)] of the Cambodian Journal of Natural History were published, all issues of the journal are freely available for download from: http://www.fauna-flora.org/publications/cambodian-journal-of-natural-history/. http://rupp.edu.kh/cjnh/journal.php https://www.asean-cites.org/#
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
